intro: Sobralia malmquistiana, commonly known as the Malmquist's sobralia, is a species of orchid native to the Andes mountains in South America. It is characterized by its striking, pendulous inflorescences that bear showy, violet-blue flowers with a yellow lip. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are elongated and革质, providing structural support and efficient water retention. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated by orchid enthusiasts, though it remains relatively rare in horticultural trade.
